description: Improvements to grass / turf playing fields to create flexible multi-sports games pitches, two new all-weather sports pitches, cricket nets and artificial wickets, padel courts, associated floodlighting and renovation works to listed stadium building, including solar panels and air source heat pumps. Remodelling car parking areas, new way finding signage across site, associated hard / soft landscape, and drainage works

Condition : 3 - No development of the upper level of the Grandstand shall take place until samples of the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the buildings permitted have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. 

The samples shall include:
(a) the upper level seats

The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved details and maintained as such thereafter.

Reason: In order to protect the appearance of the area

Condition : 4 - The use hereby permitted for the sports facilities, associated sports club, caf� and the school shall only be operated between Monday - Friday 07:00 - 23:00 and Saturday � Sunday 07:00 � 21:00.
Reason: In order to safeguard the amenities of residential properties and to ensure that the proposed development does not prejudice the amenities of the locality

Condition : 5 - The floodlighting hereby permitted shall only be operated between Monday - Friday 08:00 - 22:00 and Saturday � Sunday 08:00 � 20:00.
Reason: In order to protect neighbours' living conditions and the character of the locality

Condition : 6 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, full details of any floodlighting, security lighting or other external means of illumination of the site shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and shall include the following information:
(i) a statement setting out why the lighting scheme is required;
(ii) information prepared by a lighting engineer, setting out details of the luminaires and columns, including their type, height and location; lighting output should be low level, hooded and directional unless otherwise agreed
(iii) a technical specification of the luminaires (including lux levels), setting out what design attributes have been chosen to minimise light pollution
(iv) a plan illustrating illuminance levels across the site and at the boundary of the property, illuminance levels beyond the boundary of the site, together with the downward light output ratio of the lights and plans for screening where appropriate.
The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved details and shall be retained as such thereafter.
Reason: In order to protect against intrusive forms of lighting.
Supporting note: you are advised to refer to the following ILE guidance for advice in preparing your submission: https://www.gov.je/SiteCollectionDocuments/Planning%20and%20building/SPG%20Lightpollution%202002.pdf

Condition : 7 - Prior of the use of the new pitches and the grandstand hereby approved, the mitigation measures within the noise assessment (section 7.3 in the noise assessment dated 11 October 2023) shall be completed and retained there after.
Reason: In order to protect neighbours' living and working conditions, in accordance with Local Plan policies CC2 and EQ5 and London Plan policies D13 and D14.

Condition : 8 - All Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) of net power of 37kW and up to and including 560kW used during the course of the demolition, site preparation and construction phases of the development hereby approved shall comply with the emission standards set out in chapter 7 of the GLA's supplementary planning guidance (SPG) 'Control of Dust and Emissions During Construction and Demolition' dated July 2014, or subsequent guidance. Unless it complies with the standards set out in the SPG, no NRMM shall be on site, at any time, whether in use or not. The developer shall keep an up to date list of all NRMM used during the demolition, site preparation and construction phases of the development on the online register at https://nrmm.london/.
Reason: In the interests of air quality and to protect neighbours' living conditions and the wider local environment.

Condition : 9 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, the existing vehicular access to the site on the western extent of Hartington Road and the south of Cavendish Road shall be permanently closed and kerbs/footway reinstated so that it cannot be used as an access across the pavement.
Reason: To enhance the pedestrian environment and to confine vehicular access to the permitted points in order to ensure that the development does not prejudice the free flow of traffic or highway safety along the adjacent highway; in accordance with Local Plan policies EC1 & EC2.

Condition : 10 - The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied or brought into use until a means of access for pedestrians and/or cyclists has been constructed in accordance with the approved plans.
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the area, in the interests of highway safety and to facilitate sustainable modes of travel; in accordance with Local Plan policies CC1, CC2 & EC2.

Condition : 11 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, a Delivery & Servicing Plan (including details of vehicle access and egress arrangements and times that servicing shall take place) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall accord with current guidance such as that issued by TfL and include measures required to ensure sufficient arrangements (physical as well as managerial) for the servicing, including refuse collection, of all aspects of the development, the timing of hours for deliveries by motor vehicles and a timetable for implementation. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved details and shall be maintained for the lifetime of the development, unless the prior written approval of the local planning authority is obtained to any variation.
Reason: In the interests of the safety of pedestrians and vehicles, to protect neighbours' living conditions and to support sustainable transport objectives; in accordance with Local Plan policies CC1 & EC2.

Condition : 12 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, a Car Parking Management Plan, to include monitoring of car park occupancy and commitments to reduce the level of parking provision at the request of the council; full details of Active and Passive Electric Vehicle infrastructure and Blue Badge parking; and details of existing signage regarding the operation of the LTN, shall first be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved details and shall be maintained for the lifetime of the development, unless the prior written approval of the local planning authority is obtained to any variation.
Reason: To control the level and usage of parking on the site and to support sustainable transport objectives; in accordance with Local Plan policy EC2.

Condition : 13 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, an Event Management Plan, including appropriate measures to be in place on Event days to ensure appropriate travel for all visitors to and from the site, prioritise highway and pedestrian safety, and to mitigate negative transport impacts on the surrounding road network, shall be submitted to
and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved details and shall be maintained for the lifetime of the development, unless the prior written approval of the local planning authority is obtained to any variation.
Reason: In the interests of the safety of pedestrians and vehicles, to protect neighbours' living conditions and to support sustainable transport objectives; in accordance with Local Plan policies CC1 & EC2.

Condition : 14 - Prior to the occupation of the development hereby approved, the details of covered and secure cycle parking facilities for both long and short stay parking shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The approved cycle parking shall be provided and made available for use prior to occupation and permanently retained for use thereafter.
Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking is available on site and to promote sustainable modes of transport.

Condition : 16 - Prior to the commencement of the work, a watching brief for bats should be submitted to and approved by the LPA, and the development shall subsequently be carried in accordance with the approved details.
The watching brief shall include:
� Details of pre-development check (no more than a week prior to works beginning).
� Details of the toolbox talk with anyone involved in the construction of the development in order to make them aware of the potential presence of bats and what to do in the event of finding any.
� Careful working procedures- to be defined in the statement.
� Details of who will be watching the construction and what qualifications they hold.
� A contingency plan of what to do in case of finding a bat roost.
Reason: to ensure the protection of the protected species that may be found on the site and in accordance with NPPF.

Condition : 17 - If in case, the development works proceeds in the bird nesting season, and if works cannot be delayed, then a toolbox talk (mitigation) should be provided in the PEAR, wherein all people working at the proposed development site should attend the toolbox talk delivered by ECow, and that should provide the information on the likelihood of encountering nesting birds, the legal protection of nesting birds and implementation of the precautionary measures.
Reason: To ensure the protection of protected species that may be found on the site and in accordance with NPPF.

Condition : 18 - With respect to the submission of the report-Chiswick Sports Ground-Habitat Management and Monitoring Plan (HMMP) V1 November 2023, the content of the HMP shall also include, but not limited to the following:
? Provide outlines as to how the land will be managed over 30 years to: create and enhance habitats for biodiversity net gain, manage and monitor the BNG.
? Often newly created habitats do not thrive because they are planted or managed at the wrong time of the year. To avoid this occurring at the Chiswick Sports Ground, it is recommended that HMP should include the details of the most appropriate months to plant the trees and hedgerows and in which months (rather than seasons) management and monitoring activities should be undertaken.
? Preparation of the work schedule (including an annual work plan capable of being rolled forward over a 5-year period).
? Details of the body or organisation responsible for the implementation of the plan.
? Legal and funding mechanism(s) by which the developer will secure the long-term implementation of the plan.
? Time frame for reviewing the plan.
? Details of how the aims and objectives of HMMP will be communicated to the occupiers of the development.
If in case the aims of HMMP are not being met, remedial action will be identified, agreed with the LPA, and implemented that the development still be able to deliver the fully functional biodiversity aims (provided in the report) of the originally approved scheme.

Condition : 19 - No development shall take place (including demolition, ground works, and vegetation clearance), until a Construction Environmental Management Plan-Biodiversity (CEMP) has been submitted and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The CEMP-B provided herewith did not include details with respect to:
? Practical measures (both physical measures and sensitive working practices) to avoid or reduce the impacts during construction -method statements by the developer or contractor) before the start of the groundworks.
? Dust and air quality.
? Communication with public -development strategy can cause inconvenience to the people living nearby because of the increased traffic inflow, dust, and reduction in the air quality, that only communication can help reducing the complaints.
? Regular inspection of the machinery used for the construction.
? The submission of a verification report by ECow or similarly competent person to the local planning authority at the end of the construction period.
The approved CEMP (by the LPA) should be adhered to and implemented during the construction period strictly in accordance with the approved details.
Reason: In the interests of nature conservation.

Condition : 20 - Prior to commencement of groundworks (excluding site investigations and demolition), the applicant must submit a final detailed drainage design including drawings and supporting calculations and updated Drainage Assessment Form to the Lead Local Flood Authority for review and approval, aligned with the Sustainable Drainage Strategy (26/05/2023) and associated drawings. A detailed management plan confirming routine maintenance tasks for all drainage components must also be submitted to demonstrate how the drainage system is to be maintained for the lifetime of the development.
Reason: To prevent the risk of flooding to and from the site in accordance with relevant policy requirements including but not limited to London Plan Policy SI 13, its associated Sustainable Design and Construction SPG, the Non-Statutory Technical Standards for Sustainable Drainage Systems and Hounslow Council's Local Plan Policy EQ3.

Condition : 21 - No building hereby permitted shall be occupied until evidence (photographs and installation contracts) is submitted to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme for the site has been completed in accordance with the submitted details. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components.
Reason: To comply with the Non-Statutory Technical Standards for Sustainable Drainage Systems, the National Planning Policy Framework (Paragraph 103), the London Plan (Policies SI 12 and SI 13) along with associated guidance to these policies and Hounslow Council's Local Plan Policy EQ3.

Condition : 22 - No groundworks within the Dukes Meadows and Thames Foreshore Archaeological Priority Area shall take place until a written scheme of investigation (WSI) has been submitted to and approved by the local planning authority in writing. For land that is included within the WSI, no demolition or development shall take place other than in accordance with the agreed WSI, which shall include the statement of significance and research objectives, and
A. The programme and methodology of site investigation and recording and the nomination of a competent person(s) or organisation to undertake the agreed works
B. The programme for post-investigation assessment and subsequent analysis, publication & dissemination and deposition of resulting material. This part of the condition shall not be discharged until these elements have been fulfilled in accordance with the programme set out in the WSI.
Reason: In order to safeguard the special architectural and historic interest of the area.

Condition : 23 - Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved:
If a scheme for remediation is recommended in the Phase II site investigation for the site, no development shall take place until a remediation method statement prepared by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person to specify the works necessary to render the site suitable for its proposed end use, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.
Reason: Contamination is known or suspected on the site due to a former land use. It is therefore necessary to ensure that the development can be implemented and occupied with adequate regard for public and environmental safety.
Supporting Notes:
(i) The remediation method statement shall provide suitable details of how the risks of each pollutant linkages, as identified in the updated Conceptual Site Model, will be mitigated.
(ii) The report shall account for any comments made by the local planning authority.
(iii) Remediation work shall be carried out in accordance with the approved remediation method statement for verification and validation before the development is first brought into use.
(iv) The Council requests that remediation method statement or site plans be sent electronically to landquality@hounslow.gov.uk as well as being submitted to the local planning authority for approval.

Condition : 24 - During the development:
The Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately if any land contamination not previously identified is encountered during development. A competent person shall assess the contamination, where necessary, including soil and groundwater sampling and testing before any further part of the development that may be affected by the additional contamination that has been discovered continues.
A revised remediation method statement, prepared by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person, shall be submitted in writing to the local planning authority for approval within one month of the discovery of such contamination.
Reason: Contamination is known or suspected on the site due to a former land use. It is therefore necessary to ensure that the development can be implemented and occupied with adequate regard for public and environmental safety.
Supporting notes:
(i) Further remediation work to remove or manage additional contamination shall be carried out in accordance with the approved revised remediation method statement for verification and validation before the development is first brought into use.
(ii) In some instances, the local planning authority may require work on site to be ceased whilst the nature of additional contamination is investigated fully.
(iii) The Council requests that the revised remediation method statement or any site photos be sent electronically to landquality@hounslow.gov.uk as well as being submitted to the local planning authority for approval.

Condition : 25 - Prior to the development is first brought into use:
If unexpected contamination encountered during development, the agreed scheme for remediation, including any amendments, shall be fully implemented. A verification report produced upon completion of the remediation by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person shall be submitted in writing to the local planning authority for approval, before the development is first brought into use or in accordance with a programme approved in writing by the local planning authority.
Reason: Contamination is known or suspected on the site due to a former land use. It is therefore necessary to ensure that the development can be implemented and occupied with adequate regard for public and environmental safety.
Supporting notes:
(i) The verification (closure) report shall revisit the conceptual site model and provide evidence that each aspect of the remediation plan has been implemented correctly and successfully in accordance with current UK guidance and best practice. Where applicable, the report shall describe how any additional/unexpected contamination encountered during development has been managed in line with the revised remediation method statement.
(ii) This report shall demonstrate that the development is suitable for its proposed use in terms of land quality.
(iii) The Council requests that the verification report or site photos be sent electronically to landquality@hounslow.gov.uk as well as being submitted to the local planning authority for approval.

Condition : 26 - If long term monitoring and maintenance is required following successful completion of approved remedial measures, reports which demonstrate the effectiveness of the monitoring and maintenance shall be prepared by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person and submitted to the local planning authority according to an agreed timescale as shall first have been approved under other conditions set out in this planning approval decision notice.
This shall be conducted in accordance with current UK guidance and best practice.
Reason: In order to ensure that risks from land contamination to the future users of the land and neighbouring land are minimised, together with those to controlled waters, properties and ecological systems.

This shall be conducted in accordance with current UK guidance and best practice.
